text: hi everyone today I'm making stuffed
squid or mono tip some of you have
requested this dish many times but only
when I moved back to Vietnam I have
access to fresh squid and therefore
today I decide to make the dish for you
let's begin you will need fiber gram up
squid choose the one that have foam
flash and really clear eyes those other
indications of good and fresh squids
pull out the innards and the quill peel
off the skin
carefully remove the eyes and the ink
pocket make sure you don't poke on the
eyes and the in pocket and the white
will stay in your clothes
next soak some wood ear mushrooms in hot
water for about 10 minutes to soften and
then wash well and cut into strips and
then finally means these will add some
crunchy texture to the fillings finally
mix some shallots or you can also use
the white part of spring onion and chop
up the green parts soak a little bit of
glass noodles in cold water for about 10
minutes to soften and also chop up for
the fillings combined together to the
gram of mince pork a tablespoon of
minced shallot have a cup of the mince
wood ear mushrooms a teaspoon of chicken
stock some salt pepper and sugar to
taste the chopped spring onions and
about quarter cup of the glass noodles
mix well and set aside for about 15
minutes then stop the fillings into each
squid the fillings can expand at Discogs
so you don't need to stuff too tight the
fillings is very fragrant and full of
textures very delicious then we're going
to put the head of the squid back into
its place and then secure with a
toothpick place the stuffed squid into a
steamer and steam for about 10 to 15
minutes then take them out and place on
paper towel to absorb the excess liquid
as some are in a frying pan just enough
to cover the base and then we're gonna
pan-fry the script on both sides until
they turn Jordan prow because there's
two moistures inside the squid so the
origin is flash you can reduce the oil
splashing by adding some salt into the
frying oil and fry on low heat when the
squid turns golden brown take them out
and place on paper towel to drain off
the excess oil then cut into half an
inch thick slices while look at that so
pretty to serve you can place them on a
bed of lettuce and tomatoes a small bowl
of garlic chili dipping fish sauce or
chili sauce would be a great
complementary the filling is so tasty
and full of textures wrapped inside the
tender and slightly chewy squid rings it
tastes so good
and smell amazing I hope you're gonna
give this a try and if you do please
share with me a photo on Instagram
just insert hashtag Highland recipes so
I can fire them online thank you so much
for watching bye bye
